articles.headline: As Dollar Crumples, Tourists Overseas Reel
articles.snippet: The steep decline of the dollar against the euro has made eye-popping prices a lamentable part of the traveler’s tale.
articles.abstract: The steep decline of the dollar against the euro has made eye-popping prices a lamentable part of the traveler’s tale.
articles.lead_paragraph: HEIDELBERG, Germany, July 17  — A day after Michael Kingsley arrived in this romantic university town, he was in no mood to savor the cobblestone streets, the half-timbered houses or the flower-bedecked windows — to say nothing of the camera-ready castle on the hill.

articles.headline: Murdoch’s Arrival Worries Journal Employees
articles.snippet: Staffers at the Wall Street Journal face the uncertainty of a new owner and a suddenly harsh advertising climate.
articles.abstract: Staffers at the Wall Street Journal face the uncertainty of a new owner and a suddenly harsh advertising climate.
articles.lead_paragraph: On May 14, more than 100 reporters, editors and executives clustered in The Wall Street Journal’s main newsroom to mark the retirement of Peter R. Kann, the longtime leader of their corporate parent, Dow Jones & Company.

articles.headline: Cleric Switches Tactics to Meet Changes in Iraq
articles.snippet: Moktada al-Sadr has re-emerged, reaching out to Iraqis on the street while distancing himself from the government.
articles.abstract: Moktada al-Sadr has re-emerged, reaching out to Iraqis on the street while distancing himself from the government.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, July 18  — After months of lying low, the anti-American Shiite cleric Moktada al-Sadr has re-emerged with a shrewd strategy that reaches out to Iraqis on the street while distancing himself from the increasingly unpopular government.

articles.headline: Candidates Shift as G.O.P. Field Alters
articles.snippet: The decline of Senator John McCain’s campaign and the rising profile of Fred D. Thompson are prompting Republican candidates to rewrite their strategies.
articles.abstract: The decline of Senator John McCain’s campaign and the rising profile of Fred D. Thompson are prompting Republican candidates to rewrite their strategies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 18 — The decline of John McCain’s presidential campaign, and the rising profile of Fred D. Thompson as a prospective contender, are forcing candidates to rewrite their strategies as they adjust to a playing field vastly different from just one month ago.

articles.headline: Fed Trims Its Forecast for Growth
articles.snippet: Ben S. Bernanke said he expected “moderate” growth, but that problems in housing had tempered the forecast.
articles.abstract: Ben S. Bernanke said he expected “moderate” growth, but that problems in housing had tempered the forecast.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 18 — Ben S. Bernanke, chairman of the Federal Reserve, said on Wednesday that the economy was poised for moderate growth for the rest of this year but that continuing problems in the housing market had prompted the Fed to slightly reduce its growth forecast.

articles.headline: Retirees’ Health Costs Loom Over U.A.W. Talks
articles.snippet: The generous health care benefits paid by Detroit automakers will be a crucial sticking point in negotiations between the union and the companies.
articles.abstract: The generous health care benefits paid by Detroit automakers will be a crucial sticking point in negotiations between the union and the companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, July 18 — For the first time in its 72-year history, the United Automobile Workers union is entering national contract talks with more retirees than active workers in its ranks.

articles.headline: Pakistani Wife Embodies Cause of ‘Disappeared’
articles.snippet: Hundreds have been snatched by Pakistan’s military and intelligence services since 2001, rights activists say.
articles.abstract: Hundreds have been snatched by Pakistan’s military and intelligence services since 2001, rights activists say.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — Sitting in the sparsely furnished office of her missing husband, Amina Masood Janjua counted the calls on a recent day from Pakistanis who have suffered a fate similar to hers. More and more are coming forward, she says, to report that their husbands, brothers or sons have disappeared under the rule of Pakistan’s president, Gen. Pervez Musharraf.

articles.headline: Big Rise Seen in Demand for Energy
articles.snippet: A report by the National Petroleum Council, billed as a comprehensive analysis of the world’s energy challenge, sees a 50 percent rise in energy demand over the next 25 years.
articles.abstract: A report by the National Petroleum Council, billed as a comprehensive analysis of the world’s energy challenge, sees a 50 percent rise in energy demand over the next 25 years.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 18 — It started with a simple question by Samuel W. Bodman, the energy secretary: What does the future hold for supplies of oil and natural gas?

articles.headline: EBay Profit Is Up 50%; Listings Off
articles.snippet: The online auctioneer’s quarterly earnings beat estimates, but C.E.O. Meg Whitman hopes a home page redesign will revive sluggish user growth and a drop in listings.
articles.abstract: The online auctioneer’s quarterly earnings beat estimates, but C.E.O. Meg Whitman hopes a home page redesign will revive sluggish user growth and a drop in listings.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, July 18 — Meg Whitman, chief executive of eBay, has repeatedly vowed to improve usability of the auction site by redesigning its home page, being more aggressive in combating fraud and improving the usefulness of search engine results.
